p: The effects of black seed supplemented diets on the growth performance of rohu fingerlings are presented in Table 1. The results indicated that dietary inclusion of different levels of black seed has positive effects on the growth rate of rohu throughout the study period. A significant increase in %WG and SGR was found for rohu fed black seed supplemented diets in comparison with un-supplemented ones at each sampling day. The results also indicated that group-3 rohu (fed with 2.5% black seed supplemented diet) has statistically higher % ADWG and PER when compared with other groups throughout the study period. The CF and HSI index of black seed fed rohu was found in similar with un-supplemented ones. The fish survival rate was 100% for all the studied groups ( Table 1).
